actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1093.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. McCaul moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1093 â€” "To direct the Secretary of State to submit to Congress a report on implementation of the advanced capabilities pillar of the trilateral security partnership between Australia, the United Kingdom, and the United States."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 22.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 30.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 22.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is shceduled for 2:00 p.m. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Marcus J. Molinaro to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
